Reviews.Title: I love this Machine
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I'm a graphic/web designer who dislikes Apple's pricing strategy. I bought this computer instead of a MBp - and I love it!No issues with WIFI, the Battery is adequate for my usage. Windows 8 isn't as bad as people make it out to be. I'm in the desktop mode 99% of the time. Metro doesn't get in the way at all.Solid Performance so far. I use Photoshop & Illustrator daily. And so far I haven't done anything that presents a challenge to this machine. I would highly recommend this as a workhorse laptop. If you are looking for something to surf the web, write emails & edit word documents - this is not the computer for you - go spend $500 and get you something that matches your needs. If you need a powerful, durable machine then this is a good buy.

Reviews.Title: Simply EXCELLENT.
Reviews.Author: Brandon A Frazho
Reviews.Content: I love this computer and have had it in use for a couple months now. I wish the keyboard was a little bigger (or even had the second number pad) and the battery is a bit shorter than I expected it to be, but those are seriously my only real complaints thus far. Beautiful picture and sound, fast, lots of memory, and a solid price for a nice Dell product. I would recommend to a friend looking for something a little nicer for college or beyond. The thing that really got me was a Blu-Ray player too. Nicely done, Dell, nicely done.

Reviews.Title: Nice looking laptop but has it's issues.
Reviews.Author: codekey
Reviews.Content: I don't know if it's Windows 8 or just bad hardware but the numbers sometimes don't register when I press the keys. Unlike my work's Precision M4700 I use with separate mouse buttons, this XPS left/right buttons are part of the mouse pad. When trying to click the button a lot of times the cursor will move off what I'm trying to click. The mouse pad is terrible so I have to use a wireless mouse to make the laptop useable. Also unlike my M4700 the mouse pad and keyboard area on the XPS is an oil magnet. It picks up oils from my fingers/palm very easily. Battery life is blah, it can get me through about 2.5 - 3 hours in class connected to WiFi. Other than that the XPS is very nice and thin. The XPS starts up very quickly. I use Start8 to mimic the Windows start button like on Windows 7 because I didn't like the tiles that Windows 8 uses. I tried to upgrade to Windows 8.1 but ran into an installation issue so I had to revert back to the original installed OS. Hopefully Microsoft or Dell comes up with a fix to be able to upgrade to 8.1 with no issues.

Reviews.Title: I had to send it back...
Reviews.Author: Max "Max"
Reviews.Content: This laptop is sold as a NEW item, but actually was a REFURBISHED one...I brought the computer into France, so that made everything very complicated...I got problems from day 1, and when I tried to get help from The Computer Upgrade King, I had to call at least 10 times before someone gets on the phone. And after very little help from TCUK, nothing had changed.I tried calling Dell... There, they told me I could not be helped either, because the computer was registered under someone else's name (not specified) and I had to fill a form to change it (nothing difficult, but it would take 14 days). And that the computer actually wasn't new, it was a refurbished one. (If I knew that before, I would have never spent $1300 in a refurbished one)At the end, after around 2 weeks, I had to send it back.Bottom line... Don't buy this laptop from them. I ordered the same one from another seller, and I'm happy with it, although the WiFi problem is there! Do NOT believe that you will be the lucky one without it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome laptop
Reviews.Author: Gilberth Molina
Reviews.Content: This computer is amazing, recommended in all its aspects, has a screen with incredible colours, the keyboard is very comfortable, the aluminium finish undisputed, finally the soft part of the keyboard surface is great.

Reviews.Title: original beast
Reviews.Author: elizabeth
Reviews.Content: This laptop doesnt include instructions to use, so because its very different to just an average computer, it is at first a nightmare to figure out. we are still trying to figure out a lot, and its trial and error. a user manuel would be really appreciated. aits a sturdy, bright clear laptop. some of the function keys dont work, such as eject, but they may need some obscure combination which could have been in a user manuel if there was one.Only had this a week and hopefully will get to to actually enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: Nightmare
Reviews.Author: Richard Balding
Reviews.Content: Good computer and nice feel to it but the 16GB of RAM and 1T Hard drive (+128 flash drive) was a horrible. Very slow, constant crashing and after 3 months caught fire. Waiting for it to be solved but worst experience in 10 years.

Reviews.Title: The best of the best
Reviews.Author: Mr. AHMED S. M. MAAMARI "lord_al3in"
Reviews.Content: This is not my first XPS, but this one is amazing I love to buy this kind of laptop and I advice everyone who looking for an every day use laptop for work or personal, this is the laptop, the only problem is the software Windows 8, I recommend to remove it and I tall Windows 7, I gave my laptop to the local dealer and they downgrade it for free, other than that I really like it.....

Reviews.Title: Dell XPS 15 Review
Reviews.Author: shamik ray
Reviews.Content: Superb performance, however it encounters blue screen error quite a number of times which is atypical of windows 8. Otherwise the laptop is value for money.

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: CJJ
Reviews.Content: I am doing science so I choose a windows laptop rather than a MACbook.I got this yesterday and it's excellent.·The response time is really short and the whole system is really fast.·The graphic performance is satisfying. I played ROME II on this computer and it runs smoothly.·The design is really similar to MAC PRO. I sometimes have a feeling of using a MAC PRO with a windows system.·The keyboard is really comfortable.·The 128G SSD is really useful when I am running some resource-consuming programs.·It's not heavy at this size. But I do not recommend walk a long distance carrying it.`I've always been a windows user since Windows 98. It took me a while to get accustomed to WIN8, but after that, I'm loving this OS.`The earphone interface is a little bit too tight to plug in.BTW, UPS sucks! Stop collaborating with them!

ProductInfo.Features:
3rd Generation Intel Core i7-3632QM Processor (2.2 GHz)
16 GB DDR3 RAM
1 TB 5400 rpm Hard Drive
15.6-Inch Screen
Windows 8
ProductInfo.Name: Dell XPS 15 XPS15-1132sLV 15.6-Inch Laptop (Matte Stealth Black)
